I love Wunderlist. I'm a GTD disciple, and no app works better across platforms to keep me in sync. Very few glitches on the app. My one criticism is that there is no "New List" feature on the mobile app, only on the desktop app. Otherwise I would give 5 stars.

i have been using wunderlist for years, ever since astrid died. i loved when they added folders, and i love that i can share synced widgets with my business partner... the only thing i would change is please please give us the ability to alter that awful bright blue widget border! a nice red perhaps? or a sophisticated transparency?

It's not bad. Does what it says on the tin. But after several years of using it, the Wunderboys, now Microsoft, still have not mastered the concept of priorities. They have crappy workarounds for it, but no real priotities. Until then, no 5 stars.

Still much better than Microsoft's Todo I tried really hard to use Microsoft's Todo application. There are some features there I like (like the "Add to my day" feature). But for simplicity and stability, Wunderlist is still way ahead. I don't really see that changing any time soon.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: No easy to use, all features I need like reminders and labels in expensive version ($36). Not going to put out that kind of money, when can't even figure out how to use it.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: items/tasks disappear; Search is hard to use; Annoying user interface to enter due dates that require you to remember esoteric lexicon to do things like reoccurring dates.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: really really good app - just what I needed. it does have a few little quirks I had to wrap my head around, but overal very good

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: Bugs were fixed quickly again, soon after submitting a review. Only thing i noticed would be useful is more priority levels.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: I've been using it for just over a year now. it's apart of me now. thanks for upping the limit 300. breaking them up in to different projects is good and all but you lose two sync google calendar ability.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: I wish the app would automatically disappear from the phone's background after assigning tasks. And, a repeat period from-to.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: this app it horrible. it deleted the things i needed to do and now, i dont have a job because of this app

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: just the best. I have tried Wunderlist, MS Todo, Any.do, Google Tasks. And here I am with Todoist. Clear, simple yet sophisticated

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: it's good to do stuff but it won't let me see the tasks I've completed

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: free version is useless

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: it was easy to use the first few days, but now it's only adding everyday things (like feeding my dogs) to my list every other day, and not letting me fix it. it also doesn't send notifications so in order to remember my todo list I have to remember to open an app with my todo list.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: I found that the several tabs was unnecessary and prevents me to be productive. We have to pay for an app to get reminders. I'll rather use an app with ads if the reminder function is gone

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: actually makes me more productive! comes with a dark theme by default!

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: Seems pretty good initially. But i cant get the adding task by voice to work anymore. Google Assist keeps taking me to other apps instead of Todoist. It keeps adding items to some kind of internal shopping list. Update - I contacted support. They sent email with instructions on linking Todoist to GA. Works but too many questions now. Like others reviewers,, I just want to say. "OKG... Add task to go to store" and be done, or "Ok,Anything else?"... "no". Too much dialog now. Used to work this way?

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: I'm pretty sure I have two accounts, one through apple and one through google play. i tried to follow the instructions to deactivate one and I'm missing the button that's described in the how-to. I've reached out for help with no avail. I'll probably cancel both accounts. Two starts for lousy customer support on a decent product. UPDATE TO ONE STAR FOR NO REFUND UPON CANCELING.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: I went through all the stuff to link this to my Google Assistant, but it doesn't work right. I can get it to add a task, supposedly, but when I tell it to read my tasks it says I have no tasks for today and doesn't give me any way to list the complete set of tasks, the ones I just added. This is worthless.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: I tried it back in the summer and didn't like it. It's not easy to use and the free version is very limited. You don't even get reminders unless you pay.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: Any chance that we can get the *task function to work at the *project level so that we can have entire projects that can function as checklists where we see the tasks completed? This is the best to do app and I have a huge interest in making it better!

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: The perfect todo app. It's so easy and quick to set up really powerful filters and workflows to make sure you're focusing on the tasks that matter most. Not to mention the performance and UX is super snappy, so you can note, organize, and check off tasks without wasting time you could spend getting things done fumbling with the app.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: This app is simple and clean. I have ADHD, and I forgot what to do without a to-do list. As a result, I have tried many similar apps. This app is far and above my favorite. It's simple and easy to complete or reschedule tasks. Love it!

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: After almost two months, I'm hooked. I can't believe I haven't found this app till now, really helping me get over my hare-brained organization skills. One tip is to start small. 6 tasks per day should be easy, with each task not taking more than an hour. I've now built up to 10 tasks per day and usually accomplish 8. Here's to progress!

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: Have been using it for over 4 years now. Simple interface and easy to use. Easy to reschedule tasks too. It's become an integral part of my workday to start by seeing my Todoist list every morning

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: Great! You have finally got five stars from me. At last we have a collapsible left pane on the tablets. Next frontier would be GTD(r) implementation. Keep it up.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: My go-to task manager. Only wish is for multiple email addresses to be associated with one account. Oh, and the ability to share projects and sub-projects in one action.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: There is a sort function, but each time i made amendment or add item, it will not sort automatically and i need to manually press sort again in order to have clear view of my outstanding item according to urgency.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: labels disappeared after last update. REFUND PLEASE.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: It's ridiculous that you have to pay a subscription fee for event reminders.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: Fantastic tasks app. It can be as powerful or simple as you need, while remaining very intuitive no matter what you do. Syncing is perfect and it's beautifully designed on all platforms. The attention to detail here is unmatched (demonstrated by small stuff, like the nav bar color changing with themes).

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: I've tried a lot of organisation apps and this is my favourite, just really simple, easy to use and effective.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: This app has been a wonderful addition to my quest to being more productive. it's one of the few apps which I'm considering getting a paid subscription.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: bare minimum is free, everything else requires payment

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: why does a todo list need an account? absurd!

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: Works great on phone, consistently crashes on open on Skagen Falster 2

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: reminders is a premium feature, and thats a deal breaker. going back to Microsoft to do

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: It is good but mobile app doesn't have many options and many features are not accessible to free users.

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: The todo list items vanished after i closed the app

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: better than oulook with more options to organize

appName: Todoist: To-do lists for task management and errands
comment: Works fine, I use it on and off, eventough I have premium since 2-3 years :)

Just started using it for classwork...So far so good for my needs. Easy to organize with different folders and pages. Comes in handy using it split screen windows side by side with a reading that I need to take notes as I read. Just copy and paste key points from the reading into one note. I've been trying to find a check list option to make a list and click the item to check it off.. If there is one I haven't found it yet....If there isn't one, that would be a nice addition.

Really great! Syncs and saves rapidly. You can attach PDF 'print-outs' so you can jot down notes right next to what you are reading. Because notes can scroll down infinitely, studying is seamless and continuous. and the fact that this is accessible by all devices is AMAZING. AND NOW IT HAS YOUR STICKIES TOO! BUT one problem - sometimes, uploaded PDFs (using my laptop) are blurry when viewed using my phone or iPad.

Have been using one note for more than 6 years now and my entire learning journey is there. The only microsoft product am using right now. Feature suggestion: If you guys can let me cross post to medium directly from one note, I would use ON more often. Bless the entire team. Have a great year ahead guys!

Love being able to take notes and access them across multiple devices. Love that they can be updated offline and synced online. Unfortunately there's not enough functionality. For example when inserting a table. It's a basic shell function. Another problem i find is you can't crop images. Currently OneNote is for making notes. You have to go to other Microsoft assets to edit spreadsheets and images. Pity. Just a little more functionality and one note could be microsofts next big thing.

I moved from Evernote to OneNote. At first I was unsure about if I would stay with OneNote, for the differences caused a steep learning curve. After 1 month and finally realizing the additional flexibility I had with this program I realized a lot more potential. It seamless interface with Office has changed how I organize and manage my busy life. I moved to an Office 360 Home suite and share events and data with my family. I have scanned all documents and have access anywhere in the world. Great

OneNote is fun to use, and is very capable. I once read that "there is no one way to use OneNote." You can create Notebooks. Plus, you can fill any notebook with sections, and then fill those sections with pages. However, you may choose to work in the reverse order: pages, sections, and notebook. Then, once your work is jotted down, you can re-organize your pages in a way that makes sense to you. The Windows clipboard will definitely come in handy. I mainly use OneNote for Web clipping and URL bookmarks to remember my place for later. However, it does more than just clip web pages. You can click and start typing. Plus, you can use a touch screen computer to draw and annotate. Additionally, you can record your own voice. I miss OneNote 2007; but the newer versions get the job done.

(1) We really need "find on page" search functionality (2) OneDrive has a feature that provides a choice of requiring a passcode every time the OneDrive app is opened...can you do the same for OneNote? (3) When you hit enter at the end of a line, often the last word gets pasted to the previous line. I have seen other users cite this issue in their feedback. Hoping you will consider addressing these points (4) It would be helpful to be able to search by tags

Love onenote so much Easily organize notes with books, sections, a group of sections, huge page layout, could even make subpage and minimize them, and quick notes. Right now the only feature i wish to add is reminder. I need a reminder for my to do list, to renew license or make payment for certain service yearly or every 3/4/5 years like a pasport, that would be a great help! Pls forward this suggestion to appropriate department.

Have used OneNote for 10 years everyday for every note from every phone call or business contact and task. Can search for any note on any page and it can read my hand writing. Syncs across all my devices. I print my receipts and reservations to it. It records my meeting conversations and syncs my notes to those meeting recordings. Absolutely the most valuable daily app for my most practical needs.

The android version has never highlighted my search. It puts you on the right page but you have to find it yourself unlike the pc version. Would be 5 stars if it highlighted search. as of 1/19 search results still do not highlight even though your user support says it does.

This is an easy app to use. I like the fact that I can keep all my notes on different subjects in one place, but separate. I only bring up what I need at that time. I did have a little problem syncing to my new tablet, but I brought it to Verizon and they synced it for me. Now I have all my notes on all my devices. It is the only "note book" you will ever need.

Use daily - but with limitations. I've used OneNote for a decade. The sync function was always confusing to me - still is with OneDrive too. Now I find that the tablet/phone app is missing some important functions. I can't copy or move pages or sections. Syncing is still a little flaky. I have extensive notes on my tablet in a notebook that has never appeared on my desktop.

Part way through 2018 when inserting a photo to a page, it changed to only allowing photos from Dropbox instead of from gallery. Then it changed back to gallery and that was great because I prefer to upload directly from gallery. Just before Christmas it returned to only accepting photos from Dropbox. Can you tell me how to change the settings in the app so I can upload photos from my gallery? Thank you.

It's useful and free but it's always been clunky. Every time I use it I get annoyed with navigation and pasting stuff, formatting and even worse, trying to find text. MS just can't do search on ANY platform. Why can't it jump to the search result? Showing the page with the search hit without the line containing it is not helpful. Maybe it's a design issue, they just don't know where, on the page the search result is?

I havent had the chance to do majore work with this app but so far I'm amazed. I have used other note taking apps but this is hands down the best. It is nicely setup and and ready to use anytime. if you reallly love to take notes, this is the only app you need. suggestion for developer. Make it like reall book when u click on doc title pages fades into your text doc so u can read/ edit. On exit it fades back to page index.

OneNote can seem complicated at first, but I've used it for years. You just have to play around with it and create a few notebooks and you can get the hang of it quickly. I love the mobile app as well. So far, it has been extremely helpful for both work and home applications. I use for everything from grocery lists to collaboration with peers at work.

Buggy - constantly crashes and types extra words when I'm typing? The second star is only because it's handy to HAVE an Android version of OneNote, and it does sync nicely, but it would be lovely if it functioned properly...

Problem. New updates erase all the names on every single desktop short cut every single time. It's been at least two years this problem exists. When I only had a few short cuts it wasn't a problem. But now it's a big waste of my time restoring 30+ shortcuts every single update. Come on guys this is extremely annoying and it's long overdue to be fixed or I'm gonna have to switch to some other company

It works similarly to the old desktop app with a few less features. I miss screenshots the most. But it is nice to have notes on laptop, chromebook and phone. Not being able to do some obvious things like rotate photos is another negative. All in all, I still think it's the best note taking app available today.

Love this app. Best for keeping notes across multiple devices. I remove one Star since I have one issue with the app. The app syncs only when you open the app. If I open the app on phone after many edits on laptop, it only starts to sync then and it would take quite a long time to get sync'ed. I would prefer a regular sync like every 12hrs.

To many sync errors make this app unsuitable for me. I only use it on my phone but keep losing bits of info. Very annoying. It's a great app. Shame i can't trust it not to duplicate then lose my notes. (to see the duplicates you have to use a browser as far as I'm aware) x

no possibility to change sort order of notes, no reminders, no labels/tags, no preview for notes. still gets 3 points, as its one of the more usable notebook apps from the disappointing free offerings for android. Edit: now only 2 stars, as the app randomly deletes parts of my notes.

Useful, but frustrating. It's nice to have an app that syncs to the cloud for notes. And it's fairly well organized. But if a sync doesn't happen properly, it just gives up and yells at you to open the website version to see the conflicts. There needs to be a way to deal with these conflicts in the app itself. There also needs to be a way to change font size in the app, like the site. I paste a lot and it always keeps the source formatting, which looks awful compared to the rest of the notes.

The app itself WAS great other than minor glitches and some harsh setbacks. I was planning a comic out in onenote and had a lot of content including 50 paragraphs of storyline events, 200+ character "ideas", ect. and although it was backed up the next time I backed everything up it was emptied the names of the pages and sections remained, but all the content inside was erased. I am definitely not a fan of the new update because everytime you try and type erase something it goes to white space.

Until audio recordings on android are able to be much longer than 3 minutes, I just can't use this app anymore. I use Desktop OneNote for taking notes in my classes and as a student with a disability, I need the ability to link audio and notes. On Desktop, OneNote does this easily. Not sure what's keeping the development team from putting this in the mobile version. PLEASE take away the audio recording limit. I want to use this app on my Pixelbook, but there is no reason to.

I LOVE OneNote.. on my windows computer. I was so excited to be able to comfortably utilize my handwriting for note taking via my new Galaxy Tab S4. SURPRISE, this version is garbage. No templates, no ink to text, basically none of the feature that make OneNote wonderful.

Why is copying and pasting text in this app so terrible? Why is it when you tap to start texting notes that the text ends up in a completely different location? Why is this app so buggy? Please fix these important issues. You should be ashamed Microsoft.

Rally bad editing controls. Such a great desktop app but horrible execution on mobile. will often delete or add entire words, sentences or sometimes even paragraphs when trying to do simple things like copy/paste or spell check. every update I think they would have had to fix it by now and every update im disapointed.
Have used OneNote for many years but......since the upgrade drop down menus are now on the left hand side which doesn't work for me. Option to go back to dropdown menus along the top screen please.

Without the android app, OneNote (the best digital tool invented by humankind btw) would be almost useless. Microsoft knows this very well yet seems to have been doing only the bare minimum on Android, hence the 4 stars (OneNote itself deserves the nobel prize of organisation tools). I don't blame them. I'd happily pay for a enhanced version that would give more of the features I find on the windows version. Do you want my money MSFT?

Just what you would expect from Microsoft. Useful tool for keeping notes organized or planning projects. Great range of options. One issue, though, is that it does not automatically create a new page. Therefore, long notes end up shrunk onto a single page.

constant conflicts with OneNote Online. In some cases you have to completely DELETE your notes, regardless of all the valued information in it. I started using it again after not using it for 3 months out of frustration. Day one, conflicts. Virtually unusable app. Do not reccommend!

After the recent update, selecting extended text with S pen is not possible. Although possible with finger, it's very erratic and more often than not, delets part of text. Please fix this ASAP and get an old man's blessings.

This app is actually very good. BUT with the Galaxy Tab S4, after I take my S-Pen off the screen, the writing shift some pixels to upper left direction. It's uncomfortable seeing our own handwriting shifting every seconds. If it's not, One Note will be my main note-taking app with my 365 sunscription. PLS FIX THIS ASAP

Gets better with each update. And better still. Now there's a problem. The check marks in the check box is way too small or thin to see well. Please fix. It is a very good app. I still would like more bold checks in the boxes.
User interface is pretty rough to use and syncing is slow. Cannot collapse section groups which means to find the section you want I must scroll through all sections to find which I want.

absolutely love this app. along with the app on my phone, I use it on my computer to organize my life and stuff I come upon while browsing and school work. the only issue i have really is with the inability to move around the order of pages on the phone and inability to move sections to another notebook but not too big of a deal really. I tried evernote before moving to this and even with a subscription to Evernote, I switched! another concern is with privacy and whether our dataidonthavespaceto

I have just started using OneNote. I am still fumbling around as to how to make the best of it. It should be very useful for my daily reminders. I have to find out how to sync with my notebooks in the app on my lap top and computer. As a novice, i m unsure about using the cloud.

Loved using this app daily for accessing important notes from my phone, has been broken for weeks now with force closes even after multiple updates with supposed bug fixes, how can I rely on this service anymore? Another supposed bug fix update and still not usable due to crashes!

The last update ruined this app. It used to allow free selection upon selecting a word, and it allowed the select all option to be adjusted for less text. Both of these editing options have been removed and I have less control over the text I input. I've had this app since I had a Galaxy Victory, then to the Note 3, Note 7, Stylo 2, and now Note 8. It might be the most useful app I've ever had. No longer. I guess customer loyalty means nothing. Once I copy my info I'll be uninstalling.

Export to sd card doesnt work; i dont know what it does, but there are no txt files to import on my new phone. No other back up option, except share, but that is only one by one, so in my case of needing to transfer my 30 + notes, it is a complete dissapointment. However, I transferred the txt files on the sd card using the file manager of my old phone. Then, on my new phone, where I wanted to copy the notes, the application wouldnt see the files to import untill i created a new note; only after that it would "see" the txt files to import.

Like many other users, I have in the past appreciated this app, but apparent system changes in newer phones have caused this app to become buggy and some functions (eg. Copy and Paste) no longer work. With no updates for a long time, it seems this app has been abandoned. I would not recommend it. I'm hunting for an alternate at the moment

Was my favorite app til i changed phones. Won't let me adjust what i select for cut n paste anymore with my galaxy j7 unlocked. Just single word or entire note. Also has no way to undo accidental erasures or undelete something from trash. At least in free version. Love that i can import/export notes as readable text files instead of program only format. Would love to have it transcribe voice notes to text. The drawing part has been very useful to entertain my gkids without having to download special program and allows me to save their art.

The best, but. I absolutely admire the UI, handling, features and everything about this particular application. But what stopped me from giving that one last star was how it saves old notes on the day we modify it. I would suggest to let it show the date it was actually made on because sometimes we want a particular day to be remembered. Other than that, there is no margin of complaining.

Don't use this for important notes!. I have used this for a while. Paid for the pro version and back up. I have had a problem with the way the program handles erasing in the past. I just spent hours on a company project making notes. This has been an ongoing project, so I was going back reviewing and updating. When I attempted to remove a line it ereased two. Being important information I needed, I tried to revert the note. So now I have lost ALL of the last 3 hours of work. Please keep this in mind before buying this program.

It is great, I use it for years, really simple, intuitive and customizable . Still needs a UI update, looks really retro, though, it works well on any Android. I don't understand why people complain about not being able to backup their notes, this app even has a Google Drive plugin to be able to backup everything online, it is called NE Google Drive, or something like that. There's also a plugin for Dropbox and one for emails. Plead update the UI.

This used to be the best note app. But no longer. I guess they haven't kept up with android updates. It will no longer select text, so you are unable to cut copy paste. They do not respond to emails for help anymore. Seems like the developer has abandoned it. Running note everything pro on Samsung G7

Text Length problems anf Fonts and italics.. Before if I exceeded 750 words the app starts to slow down. Then after I reinstalled it a while ago I could write up to a 6000 words and it still works fine and now all of a sudden it slowed down again. What do I do??? Also I want to write in itlaixs or bold. I don't know if it allows that. I looked but got nothing. It would be amazing if you add it. The app is perfect and simple.

The updates to keep it working on new Android OSes are welcome. Well thought out app, and I like the custom text coloring (I have mine set to amber text on black). That said, I wish it had user-controllable arbitrary rearranging of notes. (Edit: ordering by "last edited" works well.)

Too bad this, previously great app , is so frustraiting to use now. Unable to cut and paste single word or part of the text anymore, text hides behind keyboard when typing, backing up to SD card seem mysterious and if it works, files are hidden somewhere and impossible to find. When deleting text from any note cursor moves so fast backwards, that you can easily delete entire note - its uncontrolable! Unfortunately I will have to look for another note app. Too frustrated with this one!

This app is annoying. I try to write or delete something and the cursor jumps to a random spot in a long list I'm creating and it needs to be fixed. Never did that before, I'm switching to another app that functions like this one should

I don't know why.. I can't use any other app to take notes instead of this. It's easy and simple. I've used 3 phones since 2013, and this app always stays for me. There are more apps that looks high tech *ahem* with multiple options like folding, merging etc. But this app does best for me.

Works fine but not maintaned, and not able to backup. Very good importing from other apps such as Palm but it lacks of export functions to other apps. Also it works fine in android runtime over other devices/OS BUT as the PRO addon doesn't work it will not be able to create backups to move the data to other devices. If u don't maintain allow export to loyal users

Galaxy S8+: I used Note Everything Plus exclusively for my Galaxy 3 and 4. Never had a problem transferring ALL of my notes from one phone to the other UNTIL I GOT AN S+. Note Everything Plus WILL NOT TRANSFER to GalaxyS8+. Period. I am not a happy camper. Several help requests have gone unanswered. I don't think this app is being supported anymore.

Upsell ruins an otherwise good app. I was initially happy and satisfied with it. That is until I need to replace my phone. Apparently the only way to move my data to the new phone is to pay for the paid version. Backed up my data to SD card so I can put it into the new phone but the app on the new phone refused to recognize and import my data from SD. Shameful.

It's much too difficult to move through folders and everything view isn't useful but seems to be the default. Just a simple directory is all that's needed. Can't one click to make a voice to text note. That'd be nice.

Best notepad for android. Even so, I can't select text as I was always able to do. Don't know if problem is with app or my device. I've lowered rating to four stars. If they reply to this, I might notch it back up. I'm going to lower it to one star .. Maybe that will help.

Pro version is money well spent. Exactly what I want in a note keeping app. Simple, intuitive, solid back up, (been through several phones and all notes import/export perfectly) dark theme available, lightweight @ less than 3mb, many different note taking options, from simple to durable checklists (perfect for recurring situations i.e. grocery)

A wonderful simple note app that I rarely use because of one deficiency: "PRINT" is missing from the Share menu. If that's the fault of my wifi print app (HP) then it's a pity the developer of THIS app hasn't worked that out. BTW I'm not having text selection problems others report. I can insert the cursor anywhere, select one word, several, or all. Maybe it's device- or keyboard-dependant?

Used to work better; w/workaround ok.. Back with my S3, this app worked great. But now with my S6, you can no longer Select text to copy. It is only a problem with this particular app. When I first open a note, I can select text ONCE. After that I no longer get two handles. This is really frustrating, as I use the app a lot. Update: if you tap in title text; then long-press the word you want to select, it works.

Probably the best simple note-taking app, but it does suffer from one standout bug and one slightly annoying one. Sometimes if you hit Select All and delete everything, either all of what you selected or parts of it will show up again if you close and reopen your note. And I don't know if this is Android 8.0 specific, but on my phone, hitting Select Word will now only select the first word in a note rather than the one the cursor is in.
I really love this app and still using it. There's a huge problem I'm facing for a long time. MY NOTES ARE GETTING ERASED. And I am Mad.

Old version was good and all my notes were backed up on SD card and now I have To by the full version to get to them. Not interested. And it is kinda BS to take that away after so many years of using SD backup
I like this app but the one thing it is missing is a widget that can let you see the note it self not just the title if the note as it has now. I would give it a 5 star if it had that.
I'm a heavy app user. This is easily in my top favorite just because it is practical, flexible and I found myself using it everyday. The paid version is in fact well worth the money.

Improvisation needed. This app is good . I only use it for saving text notes . I would have given five stars but .... whenever I try to select particular text for copy - cut - paste purpose , the cursor appears far away from the desired location . I have to select and unselect all the text to reach to the text I actually wanted to select - this is ridiculous . Also when I try to select text , keyboard appears . Why would one need keyboard while selecting text ? It make select - unselect process even more complicated . I will
Great for on the spot notes. Desperately needs checklist/to do list function. Audio notes could use a lot of improvement; have to turn off screen rotation to use it, or it will keep resetting.
I really like this app to make shopping list, and the voice recorder is great when in a hurry. Don't like that all my notes disappeared when my phone had a problem, still use it everyday

Great app, the only one I could find with multi-level nested folders, perfect for organizing. Interface is a little old but otherwise very easy to use. Highly customizable and no note length limit that I have been able to reach. Ability to export notes to SD card is great!

Why can't I copy and paste like normal?!. What is up with the copy and paste function of this app?! I want to select a particular word or letter then copy and paste like normal. I can do that once when I FIRST open the app/a note, but after that I get this select word option that's not helpful at all! Just let me copy whatever I want...geez!

Im totally lost with this. I bought the Pro version 2yrs ago after fearing loss 9f data. Now Im changing phones, go to export thinking Im good to go, and I've got an even bigger mess on my hands. I've gow no pro listed! Ive asked for help twice and am now ressorting to single sending my most important things through the email out 9f desperation. IM not sure why I changed from my memo app they always manage to show up when changing devices. But Im not going thug this again that's for sure.

I can see android logo instead of app logo and I am unable to open the app...please help me retrieve my data as it's very important and as app in not working I am afraid I lost all my data. I would appreciate a quick response with action.

When "export" doesn't really mean export.... I used this app on my old Moto G for two years happily taking down about 30-40 notes in that period. Every now and again I would do the export to SD card, thinking that would back up my text notes in case something happened to my phone. Well, BE WARNED, it doesn't. Read the help documentation for the BS reason why not. Basically, you need the pro version. You can back up to Google drive but, painfully, only one file at a time. I WILL NEVER BUY PREMIUM VERSIONS FROM DEVS WHO TREAT USER'S DATA IN THIS WAY.

No updates since 2016. Will no longer allow shortcuts on desktop. No ability to selectively cut and paste. I think they have just given up improving it. Both our phones run Pro versions and the issues are the same on my Samsung J7 and Moto X4. I guess we are done with this app and switching to Evernote.

The ultimate arsenal of tools to search the most minute pieces of a note, a pic, or saved site. The rubber band for the finger of the absent minded professor. Even if your organizational skills are terrible, Evernote will effortlessly sift through the clutter to find that needle in the haystack. Truly powerful, truly awesome. Works cross-platform flawlessly. Not many apps can do that. One of the first apps loaded on every new device.

great in app features however the widget could be better. I use the widget to quickly go through the tasks for the day but find it annoying when it cuts off at the bottom of the list item so it'll be better to have an item cover the entire height of the widget so everything is visible including the formatting not just plain text. Would make it perfect if updated!
1.The widget in dark mode needs a fix. While writing only text on go, the text is white on white background which is hard to see. 2. The app freezes often when selecting templates.

2 Major issues : 1. cant add tables in android app version 2. while adding pics in tables from desktop version, automatically inserting new columns and pics getting inserted in next column..very clumsy...plz fix this.
This is joking right. I cannot even access my old notes unless I pay now? This is outrage and your company will pay for it. We shall see
Wouldn't allow me to use the app at all from the moment I installed it unless I signed up for Evernote Premium. Piss right off, no
tried to reinstall  and  remove account but still cannot open encrypted contents on my Pixel. please advise how to fix it
i cant use fingerprint to unlock this apps
i am happy with the app as i can save my memories.
Evernote is the most clever, featute rich peice on my phone.
where do you get the right to charge almost as much as netflix. are you kidding....

So throughout the past five years I've been searching and trying to find the best note taking app offered in the play store. And with extended use of over 50 different note taking apps I always found myself coming back to Evernote. It's user friendly, feature rich, and aesthetically pleasing. I have been an obsessive note taker throughout my 36 year life so you can trust my recommendation that Evernote is the best note taking app available in the Play Store.

Evernote is the best app for note-taking. Especially when you're a premium user. Evernote gives me a great experience overall tho sometimes there are some bugs. I would have chosen to use it if notes were available offline. There is a premium subscription right? - Yes I should avail it if I'm capable, but I'm not. I'm just a student living in a third-world country. There is a student discount option - My school (public university) doesn't have a school address with edu domain on it.

I have to give it 3 stars because the latest updates since November 2018 have made Evernote display "Please wait" boxes or blank screens for 10 seconds+ more frequently: when loading an online note, when loading list of notebooks, when listing shortcuts. I'm not sure why there are more delays than usual. But, this is way more useful than Google Keep, more versatile than OneNote. Wish it had more Wunderlist and Quip spreadsheet functionality. Would be useful if Work Chat were more robust.

I use this app more than all of my other apps combined. It's like an extension of my brain I use to capture everything from notes on wine tasting, searchable screen shots of books I've read, names of people I meet at parties, my sons school work. I also use templates as a planner, remind myself when I need to pay my tags, get a smog check, or check my wife's oil. Evernote allows me to do all of this and the best part is that I have absolutely nothing on my desk, no mail is piled up anywhere.

It's amazing to have a sorta constant note book with you. Not to mention it preserves what is noted. Can't live without, now. Also, guys, apart from the date of updating, it'd be really great there was a "date first written". Coz, i keep updating a note a lot of times, ans sometimes i need to think back to the time I first started writing in it.

In times of large text quantities you offer no tool to search trough the note on the android phones? Are you guys out of your minds? What, I should carry my laptopt with MS Windows with me nowdays to find something in my large text note? Evernote became waste of time and as a premium user I'm forced to look for alternative!

It's really handy. I use it for everything from school notes to my own personal writing. It's great, and you can do basically everything you want from the free version! - That's what I said in 2015, before they not only added more to the premium but *took away* from the free. I dread every update.

I have used Evernote for a long time - as a journal, as a project holder, as a brainstorming tool. Great spot for bringing together small details so you can see "the big picture". For sensitive details, I recommend using a local notebook (not one that can be seen on multiple devices), and maintain your own back up of that notebook. This way, you have complete control over the details, while being able to enjoy the super fast search capabilities of Evernote. Biggest negative: Evernote features are not consistently available on all platforms... examples: vertical line; seeing tags as you view your notes; control of type size while inputting your notes; app behavior for sync; use of template feature. If you can live with learning the "core" features of Evernote, and accept what is missing on certain OS platforms, I consider my Evernote premium subscription a bargain.

Entry issues: an indented bullet replaces the first character that is an asterisk of each sentence automatically. I can't disable it. There is an ongoing issue that occurs when a note is opened _ as soon as I touch an entry, the app enters edit mode. That creates a problem because accidental changes occur. Trying to delete words the app enters additional and repetitive characters. Copy  and  paste doesn't function properly without formatting errors. My phone: Note 8.

It was an OK app til it started kicking me off for being over the two device limit. Which is OK, I'm on a free account, except that I only have 3 devices and it's not working on 2 of them - worried that it won't work on the third now too, and I'm glad I didn't have time to put too much stuff up. Doesn't give me confidence to purchase it.

Used to be a huge Evernote fan from way back in the early days. I used to tell everyone how awesome this tool was. Now, I'm just constantly disappointed. For quite a while, the app has resulted in frequent note conflicts which are not easy to straighten out. The last straw came today when the app reported yet another note conflict which (a) should never have happened because I was trying extra hard to prevent a conflict, and (b) was reporting the wrong date for the conflict.

For some reason, when you put the curser in between existing characters and begin tying, it automatically starts copy / pasting other stuff every time you click a button. This is extremely frustrating and makes it impossible to correct information without starting from scratch. I'm dissipointed that this has been an ongoing issue for so long now.

Decided to give Evernote a try again. Haven't used it as my primary note app for a while. Love the addition of a dark theme - it's a little bit too dark for my taste as it's almost black but I still like it. I do appreciate it's quick syncing - still much faster than One Note. Thanks.

Can you fix the "Dark mode" COMPATIBILITY ISSUE with the "add notes from notification bar" feature? Because the TEXT FONT IS WHITE ON A WHITE BACKGROUND when writing notes from the notification bar widget, so it is obviously UNREADABLE. Waiting for a proper dark mode!

Good feature set, but performance could be much better. Larger notes (anything north of 15KB really) can become unbearably laggy, making it impossible to type. I'd tolerate that on a low-end phone perhaps, but not on a 2016 flagship.

I love the app layout and features, but my phone's keyboard (Samsung S9) has been having issues working on Evernote. The autocorrect feature and/or the predictive text feature doesnt work properly. this makes editing in Evernote a pain, otherwise I would give 5 stars.

Since the last update, the Checklist feature got worse. Before, I could make a checklist and then check off the items easily. Now, if my thumb is slightly off, it goes into edit mode. Irritating as hell. Wish they would change that back.

it takes us to a portal to take a prime membership every minute.. its so frustrating.. it brakes the flow of making notes.. i personally would not recommend it if you don't want prime membership and store the data online only

Overrated app. It takes a lot of time to launch, display popups like "do you want basic of premium" and then keep displaying tips inside the app. It's not ergonomic or having any simplistic design. Must have been cool a few years ago but now it's just too heavy for simply taking notes. I feel disappointed as I thought my experience was going to be amazing, seeing all the ads around this app.

Latest update keeps crashing the app everytime I try to open up a note, I have to close then reopen a note. Otherwise.. I love the app! Error: "Evernote has stopped" (help fix this crash, close) Any suggestions?

Wonderful and essential app. Always helps me in my way. A few of my recommendations would be a grid view of the notes in a color coded way to each notebooks and a better reminder feature with recurring tasks that can happen daily, weekly, monthly... But still the best note app ever. Good job.

This is the best app for taking notes on any android phone. But please, how can I get the bold, italics, underline and the numbering features to function in this new version? It hasn't worked out ever since I updated my own. I'd appreciate a response, thanks.

Was nice at first. Glitchy now. When I open a not and hit "edit," the cursor and entire app freezes for several moments, and will let you do nothing. Then eventually it releases and allows you to type.

Incredibly buggy, and getting worse with each update. I can hardly even create a note now, as it constantly fails to save. Let alone trying to look through my notes, as the app is so laggy and unresponsive. The clipping feature gets stuck and just outright doesn't work- if the process even goes through, I end up with a note that says Untitled Note - Clipping no matter how much time I give it.

BUG: Lengthy notes can take forever to load. SUGGESTION (UI): Make the tool bar items the same order in both the phone app (Android) and the PC program. The numbering  and  bullet icons are reversed between the two. Requires I look closely at the (small) icon every time I use either instead of automatically knowing by the order they appear.

I can't paste text without formatting from Chrome to Evernote. Such a basic thing isn't working, why? My use case is copying song chords into a new note, but Evernote insists on garbling all text as one long string instead of presenting text in rows like Chrome. Otherwise great app of course.

Currently my default note-taking app for Android. It's good, though I think the user interface could have been a little better. But I am not gonna lie, it has got some pretty good features and a clean interface. Definitely recommended.
Needs an option to enable/disable spelling correction. Extremely annoying when I try to edit the name of an executable file. Fix this and get 5 stars and get a beer from me at City Pub.

I was a big fan of this app! ...until their auto-correct issues. EPIC FAIL Anytime I use the autocorrect function (and OFTEN when I am simply typing...), I get garbled words in my note. Makes this app UNUSEABLE!!! As of Jan 2019, this app is still a giant FAIL!!! Please fix your auto correct issues!!!

This is my favorite writing app on mobile. It's very simple and easy to use, but it also has all the features I need when writing different kinds of things. Just a slight issue when writing is that when I press enter to start a new line, sometimes the spaces get messed up and overlap over each other? It's not a big issue but it happens sometimes. Love this app, and they give proper feedback! Thank you!

Awesome app! The reason I'm giving it four stars is that I cannot figure out how to attach pictures to my documents. In the help section it shows how to do that, but it seems that my documents have a different setup for options than what is shown in the pictures. The options to attach photos is just not there. :( I wonder if it is something that can only be used if I brought pro package? I brought the creative package thinking it was the one I can put pictures in my documents with.

Edited Review: I use a Mac. I like stress-free solutions. I feel at home with this product. I think any student or writer could start with this, and be pretty happy. ... EXCEPT FOR LOSING HOURS OF WORK, DUE TO SAVE-SIZE RESTRICTIONS. Okay. Reviews aside, I can't use this program for my writing. Not if it won't save my work. When you have a novel reaching into tens of thousands of words, you DO NOT WANT A FAULTY PROGRAM. Need another solution. Done.

Okay. The apps okay. But I couldn't get the save your writing process thing because it was money even though you showed it on the pictures here on the app store. But then all of a sudden one day as I was going to work on my fourth chapter of my story it showed that my folder was completely empty and my whole story lost. I don't like to hate on people but that really triggered me after I took time out of my day to work on this story I created. At least I Printed out the first chapter.

I was happy with this app  and  paid for the Creative pro version. I've updated it  and  it's lost ALL my folders, layout  and  work + my linked jotterpad work saved in Dropbox now asks for money for cloud storage. I should never have updated the app. After being a loyal supporter I'm appalled. There's literally ONE document of many left in my Jotterpad - years of notes gone.

It's super simple, something that i greatly enjoy because something about just being able to write without any formatting tools or spellcheck or whatever else is very freeing. Jotter is great for, well, jotting things down at a moments notice, internet not required. The only problem is that it can be a little too simple, specifically a lack of italics and bold. Other than that, great!

I freakin love this app! I'm very picky on what I use to hold my stories and important documents. So for me to keep this is a pretty big deal haha! The different functions are cool to use and so much to help you with your writing. I constantly have a thesaurus around when I write, now it's built in, which saves me so much time. I like that my work is backed up. However, maybe a small tutorial on how to use things would be very helpful : 3

So I quite like this app, it's simple to use and great for jotting down ideas and stories. I'm only rating it as 3 stars now out of frustration, I was in the middle of writing when it suddenly restarted on me and I lost a good block of text. I think maybe a better save function could be implemented to make this app better...

App works great for writing, but I keep getting the message "Last sync Error: 2003". It is not syncing with the cloud. edit: That cleared the problem right up. Thank you! App is fantastic for writing, and that's the only issue I've had, other than the app deletes cloud synced text files if the file is open when the battery dies. That's a user error, though.

This is a nice app, it does the basics. it gives you a word count and has a nice color scheme. The only gripe I have is that it adds .txt to the end of the titles and there seems to be no way to organize. I'm not sure if that would change if you bought premium of not, but it works just fine the way it is.

Since BookWriter (another writing app) is basically abandoned by its developers and Wattpad is just so overpopulated, bad and with a bad reputation, I had to find another app. This app exceeds my expectations. Good job!

After last update I found a fatal bug, it ruins whole wirting experiance. after I save the text, it's there, seems fine. if I the moment I open it again chunk of the writings are gone! it make this app very unrelible, PLEASE fix this.

This is an amazing writing app; however, my old phone broke and I was forced to get a new one. On my old phone I had creative and was connected to my Google account. I was under the impression that my writing would be saved to my Google account cloud, but I was wrong. On my old JotterPad I had three novels in progress, 20+ poems and a few completed short stories, as well as several school essays and other documents. Is it possible to get these back? EDIT: thanks for answering!

This app is amazing. I enjoy writing a lot, and I take my phone everywhere. If I come up with an idea, I don't have to worry about remembering it until I go home and get to my computer. I hope to see more great apps from you guys. Love it!

Love it! Exactly what I wanted and I bought the pro version. Only thing I didn't quite like is a minor bug that crashes the app whenever I change a character's name who has more than a few lines. Thanks for making this easy to use tool for on the go screenwriters :)

This app is ridiculous. I paid for the creative version and started writing in courier prime font. But when i tried to save it in pdf , it wasn't saving with the courier prime font. The fonts are only available for writing , not for saving the document. I want to contact the developer right now because now they have cancelled the creative person and i haven't received the refund yet.

The best writing app for Android, period. perfect features, tons of customization and modes. Honestly there's no better alternative on Android. Match with Ghostwriter on your desktop PC and google drive/dropbox sync for flawless, multiplatform writing!

This app is really cool and is easy to use but the one thing which is very disappointing is that I cant download it on my laptop and is only downloaded on my mobile and tablet. I know you might be wondering when it is already downloaded in my 2 gadgets then why on laptop? This is because for me typing is more easier when it comes to laptop. So please help me to download on my laptop
Thanks a lot JotterPad for giving very nice support for even not giving you back a single coin. After phone formatted the phone my old files are lost.. was it my mistake? Thank you again.

Lost my whole story and bought the app to retrieve the information. The handy snapshot feature is great if you're like me and forget to save your stuff. Not quite sure about all the premium features but overall not bad. Good customer service too!

This is by far one of the most important apps in my phone! As an aspiring writer, it helps me a lot, and my writing has improved drastically through it! But I just wish the Thesarus and other payed features were free. My life would be much easier, but I understand you need money, so I'll just continue with the free version. My only problem is it glitches when the story starts to become long. To be specific, it slows down (Like I'm typing in slow motion) so it's harder to write. Hope this helped!

Pequenos detalhes fazem do jotterpad o melhor processador de texto que j usei no celular, facil de usar, bonito e confivel. Details make jotterpad the best text editor i 've used on a cellphone, it 's easy to use, beautiful and trustworthy

with no reason, i lost all my writings and docs. it shows that the folder is not writable and the folder is empty. i had even taken snapshots of it through the programming of the app, but i cannot find the snapshots either. and this was completely sudden.

I rarely review apps but this probably the best screenplay writing app. I paid for the premium version. The creators are quick to response if you have any issues. Only issue there is no option for page numbering, still not an issue, I still enjoy the app. Also the app developers are quick to response if there are any issues. Love the app.
Amazing app! It's amazing for my writing. One thing, though, is if you'd add the features of picking fonts and italicising and bolding letters. That'd make the app so much better. Thank you!

It's pretty good, and I love the design. However, there should be the option to have text formatting (italics, bold, etc.). If you're worried about losing the minimalistic design, simply make the extra stuff optional in settings. Without italics, it's incredibly frustrating trying to write a novel.

I am very happy with the changes this app has undergone since I used it last. I'm loving the typography, night mode, night vision, markup preview, and especially the extended keyboard with smart punctuation. It's far more comfortable to write on my phone now, when I can't use my computer. Thank you!

I personally love it, and use it to write when I'm not home and able to use my laptop. I'm considering getting the extension even. My only real complaint is the fact that you have to use asterisks to do bold and italics, but that's not even a real problem, just a minor inconvenience.

This was the best writing app, but now it's become useless. I couldn't open and edit my files that are saved in .doc format. Please provide that functionality. I have already upgraded to premium version and now it's of no use.
this is a very good app. i spend 99% of my time on it. i didn't want to use my notes app to write but i found this and i'm super happy!
formating is a bit difficult, with the italics and bold button hidden away. That's to be expected on mobile though I suppose. haven't faced any real issues with it.

Could be better. Paid for the pro version and the difference was almost unnoticeable. The one unforgivable thing about this app is the deadly and ambiguous error that pops up every once in a while when you try to save your work. It basically says that your work is off-sync or something along those lines and make you choose yes or no. Pick the wrong one and you can kiss your work progress goodbye. Lost thousands of words and plenty of precious time due to this.

Yes, this app was smooth, fully-functioning, and unwaveringly effective, but all the same: don't expect anything original, stand-alone, or fancy.... It's the bare minimum for taking notes or simple, undemanding things like that, etc. I'd suggest Pages for creative fonts and add-ons, or appealing themes, but for doing exactly what the name Jotterpad describes: hastily jotting things down, I could very well recommend this one for those mundane tasks like the grocery list!

Changes to program for $. I had the dark setting for quite awhile, now I have to purchase that setting for 7 bucks?! There are many apps out there that will cater to the visably handicapped for free, as it should be. Back to word.

As a text editor it would be much more useful to have functions to: locate a local .txt file and open it for editing; a replace function on top of a simple search function; autosave every, eg, 5 minutes; being able to handle multiple txt files. Nice-to-have: line numbers, and a go-to-line function for me to jump to places in very long file. The good thing about this editor is the rendering of text is comfortable to read, and the statistics.

Hate to rate it one star, a but major bug doesn't leave a choice. I just lost a whole damn document by simply switching the screen of while moving from train to train. The document was not yet saved anywhere, I've just started it (still, some twenty minutes of work). When I turned back the screen on and unlocked the fone, the app showed me a dialog to choose where to save the file. No complains here. But I accidentally tapped outside of that dialog... And the document was immediately gone, along with the app, that had disappeared from the task list. So it looked look a crash, except there was no cash dialog. Whale to emphasize, that side from this incident, the app's functionality is great.

Overall good But I can't apply the fonts customization to individual documents. It applies to all. I am a creative user and I want to change the appearance for specific individual docs. Please fix this
I LOVE using this because when i write songs i can read them and it dont mess up and have ads but i love this app its the best

I've already purchased the "Get Creative" package, and did so a long time ago. However, when in the app, it still asks me to upgrade and locks the Creative features away. I'd like to know how to solve this issue!

Its a simple writing app that works like a much lighter MS Word would. Its for for getting ideas out in a formatted fashion while on the go, without all the fuss most of these professional novel writting aps go through. For the record, I am a published author and award winning author of Short Fiction. I also write for comics, video games, and technical study guides. My professional opinion is if you are using an app on a mobile phone or tablet to braintrust/organize your attempt at the "Great Ame

comment: After the newest update, I can not insert a line break in a checklist item. Everytime I press enter, it inserts a new checklist item, not a line break. I need several short paragraphs in every checklist item. Please fix it so I could insert a line break in checklist item, then I will give 5 star.

appName: Keep My Notes - Notepad and Memo
comment: user friendly very handy for people with impaired sight. also good for people with colour perseption issues,light/colour sensitive as you can change background colour share your notes/checklists/voice recordings and more.tbh I havent used it a whole bunch of times but I find it invaluable for my wtiting as I have a blog/facebook pages its helpful to use this app first as sometimes social media apps crash and I lose all my writings. Ive not used it all but highly rate it cant afford the paid app.

appName: Keep My Notes - Notepad and Memo
comment: Colourful Features and Ease of Use make this a very good App for Notes , Images and more in every way. I was getting fed up after use of many pther Apps. A folder of adverts is disatracting as othetwise it deserves 5 star.

comment: This has been a great app had been a favourite for me actually however it started acting up where it no longer shares the audio files only the written notes... can this be fixed or is it a permanent thing ?

The best for them is only to improve their interface to make it modern and cute. Maybe. Btw thanks to this apps developer for developing this apps.
